intro: Proserpinaca pectinata, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and its distinctive, spiny, pectinate leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Proserpinaca pectinata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
